title: Help me to find the source of this font.
content:
Hi Colleagues,

I need a help to find the source of a font. I will be very grateful with yours wisdom, helping me to find the source of this font. The font is part of my graduate academic thesis, where I write about font revival and need, as part of the thesis, create my own revival.

The font is attached. I am working since many years in this revival and, unfortunatelly, the original source is actually lost and I cant  
remember where it comes from. Maybe the original name is signet, but I am not sure.

I need a help to fill the blanks. Is it possible?

Chyrllene K,  
Intellecta Design

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Image_4117.jpg)
author: Chyrllene K

comments.content: I don't know the original, but there is a digital version of this font called **WJPearce213**. The copyright says "Listemageren 1997" but I can't find any other info about the designer or a legitimate source to acquire it.

W.J. Pearce 213 was digitized by Klaus Johansen, postcardware:  
 [http://listemageren.dk/fontarkiv/Listemagerens-Fontarkiv.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001328/http:/listemageren.dk/fontarkiv/Listemagerens-Fontarkiv.htm "http://listemageren.dk/fontarkiv/Listemagerens-Fontarkiv.htm")

Based on an alphabet by William J. Pearce:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51780.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001328/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-51780.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51780.html")

Original scan from archive.org:  
 [http://archive.org/details/alphabetsoldnewf00dayl](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001328/http:/archive.org/details/alphabetsoldnewf00dayl "http://archive.org/details/alphabetsoldnewf00dayl")  
<iframe src="/web/20130416001328if_/http://archive.org/stream/alphabetsoldnewf00dayl?ui=embed#page/216/mode/1up" width="480px" height="430px" frameborder="0"></iframe>

Thank you for your help!  
Got information on this site and BriarPress, and now I have everything I need.

Thank you so much!!
